results.title: Privates on parade
results.creator_credit: Michael Blakemore, Simon Relph and Hand Made Films
results.brief_description: To fight the good fight, British soldiers in Southeast Asia will need to laugh the good laugh. That’s where Major Giles Flack (John Cleese) and his morale-boosting theatrical troup led by the gloriously high-camp Acting Captain Terri Dennis (Denis Quilley) come in. The war and the show must go on! A farcical musical comedy underscored by the realities of war. Screenplay and lyrics by Peter Nichols based on his own play “Privates on parade”, music composed and conducted by Denis King. Cast also includes Nicola Pagett, Patrick Pearson, Joe Melia, Simon Jones, Michael Elphick, John Standing. Executive producer - George Harrison (Beatles). Contains b&w scenes.

results.title: Private and confidential
results.creator_credit: Joe Bogdanov and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: It was the first time a boy had kissed me. I felt as though I was reeling, soaring drowning-all at once, I gave myself completely to his lips! So thinks the teenage heroine of this in-depth look at True Romance Comix. The stage is set for Joan’s undoing. Useful for exploring popular culture, sexism and melodrama. Winner, Diploma of Merit, Melbourne Film Festival, 1984.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Joe Bogdanov and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School

results.title: Prisoners of propaganda
results.brief_description: In 1943, the Imperial Japanese Army Secret Service forced a group of Australian servicemen to appear in a film to show the “exemplary” conditions under which Prisoners of War were treated by Japan. This program looks at the mysterious story behind that film, titled, Calling Australia.

results.title: Prisoners of debt: inside the global banking crisis
results.creator_credit: Peter Raymont, Robert Collison, John Kramer, John Spotton and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This fast-paced documentary tells the inside story of how Bank of Montreal chairman William Mulholland dealt with his bank’s debt-laden customers, Dome Petroleum and Mexico, during the summer of 1982, the summer the global debt crisis took the world by surprise. Interwoven with the Bank of Montreal’s story are interviews with well-known international bankers and financial experts who explain the causes of the debt crisis, confirm the extreme fragility of the international banking system, and outline the problems to be solved if the system is to survive.

results.title: Prison
results.creator_credit: George Geertsen, Don Rennick and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An animated film about what it is like to serve a term in jail. The authenticity of the film comes from careful research, interviews with prisoners, on-the-spot drawings and a sound track that was partially recorded inside a prison.
results.creator_credit_for_label: George Geertsen, Don Rennick and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Prince William: behind the headlines
results.brief_description: This is a probing, insightful and frank look at Prince William Windsor, son of Prince Charles and the late Princess Diana, the young man who will be the future King of England. At 18, moving into manhood and being plunged into the tumultuous environment of a scandal-ridden and emotionally scarred British monarchy, is he ready for the challenges and responsibilities that lie before him? This video reveals a side to ‘Wills’ (as his mother affectionately called him) that has rarely been seen before.

results.title: Prime suspect 3
results.creator_credit: David Drury, Paul Marcus and Granada Television International
results.brief_description: DCI Tennison (Helen Mirren) has made it in a man’s world and secured the position of a high ranking policewoman. In this third instalment of Lynda La Plante’s series Tennison is given the assignment of cleaning up the murky world of prostitutes, or “rent boys”, due to public pressure about the standard of morality in Soho- Operation Contract. The nature of her assignment quickly changes tack when one of the boys perishes in a suspicious fire. Strange details begin to emerge, such as forensic evidence that the victim was unconscious when the fire started and someone called an ambulance to the flat that night The suspects soon mount- the sleazy pimp, the head of a centre for troubled boys, and a respected police official. Tennison’s personal life is not without upheaval during the investigation as an old flame enters the scene, causing her to question life’s decisions. As Tennison leads her investigative team into an underworld populated by paedophiles, pornographic photography, transvestites and abuse, the shocking truth is revealed and Helen must make an important decision. Cast includes Vera Reynolds, David Thewlis, Danny Dyer, Tom Bell and Ciaran Hinds.

results.title: Priit Parn: selected films
results.brief_description: This tape features three films from the award winning Estonian animation director and political cartoonist, Priit Parn. An artist who uses animation to satirise and parody the old Soviet system and the conflicting outcomes of Perestroika. His films are rich with repetition and allusion, and as with much Eastern European animation, is laden with symbolism. “Time out” follows the antics of a hero cat (produced by Hille Koosk); “Breakfast on the grass” provides a parallel with Manet’s work and reveals bureaucracy at its most malign (produced by Tallinnfilm); “Hotel E” explores the process of Glasnost, using a hotel setting as a metaphor for East and West (produced by Olav Osolin).

results.title: Pride and prejudice. Parts 1 & 2
results.creator_credit: Simon Langton, Sue Birtwistle, Arts Entertainment Network and BBC
results.brief_description: Jane Austen’s famous novel is brought to life in this vibrant, fresh adaptation. Full of energy, the script, performances, sets, locations and costume design are excellent, while the overall production veers away from the formality of previous adaptations. Colin Firth and Jennifer Ehle are Darcy and Elizabeth and they are joined by a large and well-known cast including Barbara Leigh Hunt, Alison Steadman, Julia Sawalha and Susannah Harker. The underlying initial tension between Elizabeth and Darcy, develops into love, and their faults; pride on his part and prejudice on hers, blossoms into a deep and lasting mutual respect.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Simon Langton, Sue Birtwistle, Arts Entertainment Network and BBC

results.title: Pretty Penny
results.creator_credit: Shane Luther, Jacinta Stone and Australian Film Commission
results.brief_description: A light-hearted cautionary tale about human ambitions and moral dilemmas that centres on the relationship between an avaricious coin collector and and a woman who owns a rare coin. Cast: Kestie Morrassi, Shane Luther. (Awards: Sydney Film Festival, 1999; Watch My Shorts Film Festival Melbourne, 1999; Sydney Video & Film Festival, 1999)
